author: Peerzada Ashiq
text:
Soldiers take position during an encounter with militants at village Gusoo in south Kashmir’s Pulwama district on Thursday. - Photo: PTI

Two Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) militants were killed in an encounter in south Kashmir’s Pulwama district, 30 km from Srinagar, on Wednesday night.

According to the Srinagar-based defence spokesman, the killing was a “major success.” “Two hardcore LeT terrorists were eliminated in a fierce encounter, which erupted on Wednesday evening at Gusoo village of Pulwama district,” said the spokesman.

The militants were trapped in a joint operation of the Army and the police.

“The joint search operation was launched after intelligence inputs were received about suspicious movement of terrorists in Gusoo,” said the spokesman.

The security forces cordoned off several houses.

It was late in the night that militants tried to break the cordon by firing indiscriminately, following which an intense exchange of fire ensued.

Two militants were killed in the shootout. One slain militant was identified as Manzoor Ahmad Bhat, a resident of Aloochibagh, Kakapore, who joined the LeT in May 2015.

The identity of the other terrorist, who was of foreign origin, could not be ascertained.

“The operation also led to the recovery of two AK-47 rifles, four AK-47 magazines and other war-like stores from the slain terrorists,” said the spokesman.

Following the killing, dozens of protesters hurled stones at the security forces, who burst teargas shells to disperse them.
title: Two LeT militants killed in Kashmir encounter
